item.title: About
item.description:
The purpose for me to have these pages is to have a place to write down and document what I learn, explore and set up. I find it helps to write down what I learn as if I were to teach it to someone else. If I’m not able to explain it, then I know I haven’t really understood the topic.

A lot here will not start completely from the beginning, for the absolute beginner, as I have some knowledge of some fundamental things. For instance it is assumed that you know how to use the package manager that comes with your Linux distribution if that is the topic. Things like declaring variables in various programming languages are also pretty basic, but I might document it in any case since they can differ a bit, or have something special to the language.

item.title: Now
item.description:
This is a new concept to me, but I liked it so I will try it. This is an idea by Derek Sivers which you can read more about here: nownownow.com

Right now I am: #

  • Starting my blog, which is a lot more work than I had hoped
    • I do hope I can get the server stuff out of the way so I can focus on what really interests me right now, which is development
  • Learning programming, TypeScript/JavaScript for now, but I really want to learn more about Python, Go and Rust as well
  • Listening to the Expanse series audiobooks
  • Staying mostly indoors during weekdays as winter is here and it is cold and dark outside
  • We’re reorganizing at work for the second time this year, and that has a higher mental cost than anticipated, so it reduces what I have the energy to get involved in
